channel.title: CVE Feed for Avaya -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Avaya -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-32218|2023-05-30T00:00:00 -- avaya -- ix%20workforce%20engagement
item.description: Avaya IX Workforce Engagement v15.2.7.1195 - CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')

item.description: Avaya IX Workforce Engagement v15.2.7.1195 - CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials

item.title: CVE-2023-31186|2023-05-30T00:00:00 -- avaya -- ix%20workforce%20engagement
item.description: Avaya IX Workforce Engagement v15.2.7.1195 - User Enumeration - Observable Response Discrepancy

item.title: CVE-2023-3527|2023-07-18T21:10:36.841Z -- avaya -- avaya%20call%20management%20system
item.description:
A CSV injection vulnerability was found in the Avaya Call Management System (CMS) Supervisor web application which allows a user with administrative privileges to input crafted data which, when exported to a CSV file, may attempt arbitrary command execution on the system used to open the file by a spreadsheet software
such as Microsoft Excel.

item.title: CVE-2023-3722|2023-07-19T19:56:52.681Z -- avaya -- aura%20device%20services
item.description: An OS command injection vulnerability was found in the Avaya Aura Device Services Web application which could allow remote code execution as the Web server user via a malicious uploaded file. This issue affects Avaya Aura Device Services version 8.1.4.0 and earlier.

item.title: CVE-2023-7031|2024-01-17T18:34:41.831Z -- avaya -- experience%20portal%20manager
item.description: Insecure Direct Object Reference vulnerabilities were discovered in the Avaya Aura Experience Portal Manager which may allow partial information disclosure to an authenticated non-privileged user. Affected versions include 8.0.x and 8.1.x, prior to 8.1.2 patch 0402. Versions prior to 8.0 are end of manufacturer support.
